def.dt: :to take a child of other parents legally as your own child no obj They were unable to have children of their own, so they decided to adopt. + obj They decided to adopt a child. He was adopted as an infant.

:to begin to use or have (a different manner, method, etc.) Their boss has recently adopted a friendlier manner. [=has started behaving in a friendlier way] Did he adopt your point of view? We adopted some of the local customs.
:to begin to use (a name that is not your real or original name) The author Samuel Clemens adopted the name “Mark Twain.”
:to live in (a country that is not your original country) and regard it as your home He was born in England but he has adopted Canada as his home.
:to accept or approve (something, such as a proposal) in a formal or official way The assembly adopted a new constitution. The resolution was unanimously adopted by the Senate.
:to select (someone) officially as a candidate The party adopted [=selected, chose] her as its candidate for mayor.

utxt.vi: an adopted child [=a child who has been adopted]
“Mark Twain” was the adopted name of Samuel Clemens.
